Title: Megan Kitchener

Description:
The Universal Church of the Kingdom of God (UCKG) is a Christian Ministry and registered charity (1043985) dedicated to helping people live life to the fullest — physically, emotionally and spiritually.

Over the years, we have reached such a diverse group of people that our work has touched millions across over 100 countries. Their unique stories remind us that with the right kind of help and support, the most heartbreaking stories can become tomorrow’s inspirational ones. In these testing times, we are determined to do more. Support us
Title: Saheeda's Christmas Fundraising

Description:
To our wonderful donators! Last year we ran 10k and this year we're going Bigger and Better to raise as much as we can for this worthy cause by running 20k! We need your support. Our run will take place on Saturday 18 December!

Please check out the video link https://youtu.be/TSSsyxpDh5E to see where your donation is going.

As part of the UCKG HelpCentre's response to Covid-19,we’d like to tell you about an exciting new initiative called 5Alive last year! This year is Bigger and Better! We have worked and are continuing to work hard to deliver five major community projects this year, with the aim of keeping various members of our community alive throughout this difficult time.
We currently operate a 24-hour helpline, run weekly soup kitchens in five different locations that have fed over 2,000 people throughout the pandemic, as well as food banks in several of our centres across the country. The initiative also includes two other projects: “Night Angels”, which sees our volunteers take to the streets during the night to provide basic necessities and food packs to those still sleeping rough; and also the Give Warmth Appeal, which extends aid not only to the homeless and those sleeping rough, but to children in hospitals, the children of prison inmates, and others, through gift-giving and the provision of items that will help those struggling get through the cold winter months.

Description:
Welcome to my Swim22 profile page for Diabetes UK. Did you know someone is diagnosed with diabetes every two minutes? As many as 4.8 million people are living with diabetes in the UK right now. 

As a student podiatrist (due to graduate in June 2022) I've seen the life changing impact diabetes can have on foot health.  Diabetes leads to more than 176 leg, foot, or toe amputations every week in England, and the life expectancy of people with diabetes is shortened by 15%. The financial cost to the NHS is huge; £1 in every £140 of NHS spending goes toward foot care for people with diabetes. So, I'm swimming towards a better future for people living with diabetes. Support my challenge by hitting the donate button on my profile page.

Make-A-Wish UK grant magical wishes to enrich the lives of children and young people fighting life-threatening conditions. Granting their wish provides seriously ill children with hope for the future, strength to cope and resilience to fight their condition. They’re given quality time away from the daily realities of living with their condition and given the chance to make magical memories they can treasure forever – whatever their future may hold. We want to transform the lives of 1,000 children this year by granting their One True Wish!

Title: Paramount Group - The Peoples Kitchen

Description:
The blessed month of Ramadan is upon us. A month full of blessings and rewards. Many of us, by the grace of Allah, will open our fasts with abundant food. However, there are those who are less fortunate than us, unable to even obtain a morsel of food. It is our duty to feed and clothe the poor as they too have a right over us. 

Recently having watched a video in which a young boy in Syria resorted to eating grass due to starvation, resonated deeply within me. So, let’s not allow another child resort to such measures. 

Al-Khair’s Ramadhan Kitchen could provide cooked meals for people in Lebanon/Yemen/Gaza- or even many more. 

Please donate generously, so that our brothers and sisters are able to open their fasts with something more sufficient. 

The reward of feeding the poor is immense, and the Qur’an tells us that the righteous “give food, out of love for Him, to the poor and the orphan and the captive, [saying] “We feed you, for Allah’s pleasure only — We desire from you neither reward nor thanks.” [76:5-12].

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Ramadan is the most wonderful time of the year, full of countless reward, blessings, mercy, togetherness and forgivenesss. It is the perfect time for us to come together, give thanks to Allah (swt), and give to those in need.Many of us are fortunate enough to have a cooked meal during suhoor and iftari, however, this is not the case for the thousands living in war-torn areas. 

With your help we can help raise money to provide cooked meals to 500 people in Lebanon/Yemen/Gaza. These people have little or no means of providing for themselves, and during this month of Ramadan we should uphold our values and think of those less fortunate than ourselves. 

All donations will be sent to the Al-khair foundation, so that they are able to use this money to provide families and children with meals. 

And they give food, out of love for Him, to the poor and the orphan and the captive, [saying] “We feed you, for Allah's pleasure only — We desire from you neither reward nor thanks. Surely we fear from our Lord a stern, distressful day.”

Many thanks for your support. 

Let’s make a difference starting today.

Description:
We will be able soon, with your generous support, to seat and feed double the number of homeless, underhoused and rehabilitating guests 2-3 times a week in this new, large, comfortable space. For the first time they will all be able to choose where they sit and for how long (especially vital in cold and wet weather when rough sleepers need to take time to “warm-up” and dry out). The newly enlarged LifeHouse will seat 50-55 diners, not the 28 we squeeze in now!

Our guests will not be hurried along to make way for the next person. Sadly queueing outside in all weathers had been a regular feature of the LifeHouse up to now.  On a Thursday evening diners can enjoy some live music from all sorts of local artists free of charge. So this can become an unhurried, dignified and sociable meal out for our guests rather than a short, scrambled meal limited by time and have coffee after in the sofa area.

The major design, surveying, permissions and building work, is being done and very generously paid for by PMC Construction: www.pmcconstruction.co.uk.  Since 1982, PMC Construction has developed housing and commercial schemes that are built to last.

The front of the building seen here will be the new, main dining room and we hope that you might decide to help us refurbish and equip it! The lighting is very outdated and needs replacing. We will need a range of trolleys and serving equipment. The old diner area will be kept to provide a space where people can get support can sit, have coffee, play table football or table-tennis or just chill out and socialise - something they don’t get to do before. 

In this season ahead we need to fund decoration, folding tables,
lighting, heated food trays, trolleys, extra fridge and floor coverings.
Title: RAISING FUNDS FOR DINING HALL REFURBISHMENT & EQUIPMENT

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Planning lessons and marking are no longer on my to do list in the evenings, so I have been able to help a local hub to sew scrubs and have recently started making a few face masks during my spare time. I thought this is a great opportunity to raise money for a charity that runs by the people who are very close to my heart. The LifeHouse is a resource, support centre and kitchen that serves hot food in Albert Road, Southsea. They aim to target immediate needs and issues surrounding homelessness and addiction for those in need in Southsea. This place relies heavily on a team of dedicated volunteers (who are amazing!!) and local donations with food, clothing etc. Since their recent site expansion and refurbishment, they are hoping to be able to upgrade their kitchen equipment, furniture, and more importantly to be able to accommodate more people who are in needs. 

There is no set price of each face mask, but we ask for minimum donation of £7 for each which include postage. Each mask contains a small strip of wire so it can sit nicely on your nose. With a pocket on the reverse side where you can insert additional materials. Pattern choices are limited so message me for stock availability. Once you have made your donation, message me with your pattern choice and address and I aim to dispatch within 5 working days (I can only make these in the evenings!)
Title: Vivys homemade face masks

Description:

Our chosen charity for the year is The LifeHouse Southsea. Based in the heart of Southsea, The LifeHouse is a support centre and kitchen that targets the immediate needs and issues surrounding homelessness and addiction in Portsmouth.

All support will be greatly appreciated, whether it's a donation or simply going down to cheer them on! We wish them all the best of luck! Go on girls!

Team Canteen X

Description:
On Sunday I’m attempting my first marathon. I’m running alone and feeling nervous and under prepared, hoping my knees and balance will be up to the mud, shingle and incoming tide!  However, I know that afterwards I can return to a warm house for a hot shower, PJs and replenish my energy with piles of mince pies!

Sadly, many people do not have a safe home, access to a shower, fresh clothes, family support or regular meals. 

The LifeHouse is a kitchen, resource and support centre that serves hot food in Albert Road, Southsea. They also provide clothing, health advice, counselling and career support. 

They welcome everybody including homeless, rough sleepers, underhoused, sofa surfers, those feeling disconnected or/and not so well in themselves, lonely and lacking friendship.

Description:
Salam, pray this message reaches you all in good health. 

We are now raising funds to build a new kitchen for a childrens school in Gambia. 

This school was established in 2009 and has 184 students, that it serves with a quality education, it is an islamic school but also teach subjects such as Maths, Science, English and and Social studies. Through government funding they are able to provide daily nutritious meals to these students. However the facilities in this "kitchen" are not great, currently meals are cooked in a metal shack and is far from a desirable state to cook healthy and nutritous meals. 

Alhumdullilah thanks to a borehole that was recently installed, the children have access to clean water and its time now to go further. With your support, we aim to build a new kitchen where the faciliies are cleaner and in a much better condition to serve these children with daily nutritous meals. 

Any amount you can donate, is truely appreciated by the children of Gambia. 

Jazak'Allah Khair
Title: Build a Kitchen for a Childrens School

Description:
On Saturday 9th May, we lost our beloved Dad, husband, Grandad and great-Grandad. He had fought hard for months but in the end, his leukemia and Covid took him from us. He will be forever in our hearts.

Typical of Dad, he did not want any fuss at the end. He simply just wanted to go. To respect his wishes, we would like to ask for donations instead of flowers. Dad was a huge animal lover and especially in the last few weeks, he got an enormous amount of joy just sitting in the garden with his dogs. Therefore, it seems fitting to support his local animal rescue home. We are sure this would make him happy!

Please feel free to donate if you would like to and to leave a message or memory of Eddie.

Dads cremation is taking place on Tuesday 26th May. Please feel free to raise a glass or two for him.

Thank you for support,

Ann, Quentine and Michaela
Title: In memory of Eddie Kitchen

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I am Sara and I’ve been working as a rider at Neil Mulholland Racing for 3 years now and loved every minute. 

I will be riding Soupy Soups in the 1m2f Racing Welfare charity race the 24th of October 2021 at Wincanton Racecourse.


For all of you that know me, it’s no surprise how thrilled I am for the chance of riding the yard all time favourite horse in a “real race”and, for once, experience what it feels to be on the saddle on the other side of the white railing. 


For all of you that don’t know me, this could be a lovely opportunity to see how incredibly loved racehorses are and how hard stable staff works towards their fitness and  overall well being. 

Please join me in this race helping me raising money for the charity that is making this possible!


Follow my journey here or on my Instagram page: _alaskan_sun_



Racing welfare is an amazing charity that provides guidance and support to everyone who works in the racing industry and their families, throughout their career – from recruitment to retirement.

I came across Racing Welfare Charity when I joined the National Horseracing College a few years back and the help and support I have received from them it has always been outstanding. I am currently training for my HGV driving license thanks to their grants scheme to help people improve into their career paths and always be grateful for it. 

I also want to thank my trainer Neil Mulholland and horse’s  owner Equis ex Inceris partners for giving me this chance. 

Thank you so much for your support! 

Sara

Description:
Instead of wedding presents, we'd love for our guests to donate to the Albert Kennedy Trust (akt), if they feel able to do so.

About akt:

Lots of young people come out as LGBTQ+ to their families and are embraced and supported. But that’s not always the case. Coming out, or being outed as LGBTQ+ can lead to young people being made homeless. This is the reality for 77% of the young people akt supports. Sometimes families are unaccepting and abusive. The locks changed. Possessions destroyed. akt exists to support these young people and can offer safety and hope in an open and accepting environment. We help with housing and also to help them celebrate their identity.

CharityName: PASIC - Cancer support for children and young people
Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. 

My name is Jo and I love to dance, especially in the kitchen to 80s tracks! Throughout the last few months, I have been running fun dance-fitness classes virtually on Zoom and Facebook which has brought a lot of joy to many people including myself. 

So I would love you to join me for a 6-hour dance extravaganza on Saturday 14th November from 1-7pm in support of the wonderful Nottingham-based charity Pasic who provide the families of children and young people with cancer in the East Midlands with emotional, practical, and social support. The money raised from the danceathon will go towards Christmas treats and gifts for the children being treated on children's cancer wards in the East Midlands as well as offering much needed support to parents during such a difficult time which has been heightened due to the pandemic. Pasic would also usually host their ball at this time of year which raises a lot of money for the charity so I'm hoping to offset that, even if just a little with the money raised.

As well as plenty of themed Kitchen Dancing from ABBA Mania to 80s Pop through to Disco and Musicals, we're delighted to welcome guest dance instructors offering a variety of dance genres including: -

- FitSteps and seated SOSA with Catherine Chivers from Manor Arts - https://catherinechivers.wixsite.com/manor-arts
- Teenyboppers with Steph Metson Scott
- Belly Dancing with Hannah Enderby (Keep Fit and Carry On!)
- Fitness Fun with comedienne Jemma 'Flashdancer' Bennett (Stand Up from the Shed)
- Power ballad weight workout with Louise Strain from Be Motivated Coaching - https://bemotivatedcoaching.com/ 
- Latino beats, Family Boogie, 80s & 90s & a Vogue dance workshop with Jo '80s child' Porter PLUS loads more


Full schedule is below and join in at any time. The event Zoom link will automatically be sent to you by e-mail if you donate via this page or alternatively register your interest at https://www.trybooking.co.uk/VIM.  The event is open to a maximum of 500 participants over the duration of 6 hours so please join is as early as you can to guarantee your place. As this is a live, virtual event, we can't guarantee there won't be any technical or wi-fi issues but fingers crossed!

On a personal note, I would like to dedicate this event to the memory of a very special girl, my cousin Rose Whittle, a bright shining star who loved to dance, sing and entertain with her jokes. Rose was diagnosed with Neuroblastoma in 2011, at just 7 years old, and her positivity and light shone throughout her gruelling course of treatment at QMC in Nottingham which she battled through courageously for over 2 years. We devastatingly lost Rose in 2013 but her memory lives on in all of us who loved her so dearly which brings us hope and inspiration everyday.

Description:
An organisation which has supported homeless and vulnerable people in Newcastle for over three decades has been named by Sintons as its new staff charity.

The People’s Kitchen was established in 1985 when its founder, Alison Kay, heard about the death of a homeless man in the city.

Since then, the charity has grown to support countless people from its base in Newcastle city centre - aptly named the Alison Centre - by offering food, vital supplies, conversation and friendship.

Now, The People’s Kitchen will be Sintons’ staff charity for the next two years (2022-2024), and will be the focus of the firm’s fundraising efforts during that period.

Its support for vulnerable people in Newcastle has never been more needed, with poverty and homelessness continuing to rise.

Description:
Rob Kitchen (1964-2018)

Rob Kitchen was a likable character with an endearing personality who began working with the finance team at Salford City Council in September 2005.  He initially came across as a quiet and private individual, but once you got to know him you found that he had many varying interests from rock music to history.  In particular Rob had a passion for the arts and was a frequent patron of ‘Home’, formerly ‘The Corner House’.

Rob commenced 2018 like any other year and was present in work during the month of January. Unfortunately though, he became ill very quickly and sadly passed away in March 2018, aged only 53.

Rob received excellent care in Christies for the last month of his life and as a result we, ‘Rob’s Runners’,  are going to run/jog/walk the Salford 10k on Sunday 9th September 2018 in his memory.

If you would like to join Rob’s Runners please email kieran.mcelwee@salford.gov.uk or
mags.miller-cobham@salford.gov.uk for further details.

Description:
This year I am fundraising for The People's Kitchen, a charity located in Newcastle that provides meals for the homeless and disadvantaged individuals.

I want to support this cause because every time I stroll through the streets of Newcastle, I am always stunned to see a large number of rough sleepers that are wondering if tonight they will be fortunate enough to eat or find a one-night placement at a shelter.

I realise how lucky I am to have a roof over my head, a fridge full of food, and clothes on my back. I have a boiler that kicks in when I am cold; these poor souls only have the streets.

So, my mission is quite a simple one, this year I want to fundraise at least £100 (To buy 100 dinners for people who need them).

I will donate £20 that I have saved in fuel since the university moved to online sessions. Please give what you can if you would like to contribute towards this great cause.

Title: Catalina's We make a life by what we give (W.C.)

Description:
On 10 July 2022 I will be attempting to complete the Etape du Tour 2022 in support of The Children's Trust and The People's Kitchen. Both causes are equally fantastic for very different reasons and any donations you are able to make would make a real difference to both charities and the people and communities they support. I have seen first hand the great work they do for vulnerable people in Newcastle through my work with them at Tesco. You can donate to The People's Kitchen on this page and learn more about the great work they do through the links on this page.

I feel compelled to state that whilst I fully expect to complete this challenge there is a genuine risk of failure given I am an amateur cyclist, approaching 50 years of age, with about 2 stone to lose, no experience of riding for over 7 hours, or riding Tour de France stages , up large mountains, or in potentially extreme heat. So whilst I will commit to my side of the deal over the next 6 months I can not rule out not reaching the summit of the final climb at Alpe D'Huez and any donations should not be conditional on completion!

If you are able to support in any way at all both I and the charities would be hugely grateful. Thank you!

The 30th edition of the "Étape du Tour de France" will take place on 10 July 2022 on the same route as stage 12 of the Tour de France, between Briançon and Alpe d'Huez, covering 170 km with more than 4,700 metres of climbing, including the climbs of the Cols du Galibier and de la Croix de Fer before finishing with the climb to Alpe d'Huez... Training started 1 January! 7 days in and legs already very sore - is that a bad sign?

Title: Save our Rohingya kitchen

Description:
Together We Can

The Coronavirus pandemic is an unprecedented time for all of us but vulnerable people in particular are facing more uncertainty than ever. Rough sleepers need additional support to self-isolate and protect themselves from Covid-19. Providing someone with a place to stay, a meal to eat and someone to talk to, are invaluable in supporting struggling individuals find their feet again during times of a global pandemic or otherwise.


Christmas time can be the most difficult for homeless people, both
because of the cold weather that makes sleeping rough even more
dangerous and because of being without family at Christmas. Unfortunately Covid-19 pandemic has only increased this. There are
many factors that can lead to homelessness and it is often the most
vulnerable people in our community that are affected.

To watch the video click the link Together We Can

According to Catching Lives, a homelessness charity aimed at supporting rough sleepers, homeless and vulnerably housed in Canterbury and East Kent, there is even less support available than previous years due to funding cuts by the government. Homelessness rose by a record 22% last year, with 726 deaths in 2018 and expected increase this winter.  For the people that Catching Lives supports, it can be a long journey to getting back on their feet and recovering from the trauma of rough sleeping. Providing someone with a place to stay, a meal to eat and people to talk to, simple things that most of us take for granted, are invaluable first steps to getting the support they need.

At Herringbone Kitchens we know how fortunate we all are to have warm homes. As a company we have supported Catching Lives, for the past 7 years through donations and by giving our time cooking meals for the homeless. A service particuarly close to our hearts is the Catching Lives Night Shelter, which provides 2400 bed spaces over December through to March for people in need. The charity also offers basic meals, showers, laundry and storage facilities.

This year we want to help Catching Lives show the real face of homelessness and to help raise money for the Winter Night Shelter. To encourage businesses and people about the small things we can all do to make a difference, we worked together with Catching Lives to produce a Christmas tale - “Together We Can”. This video is a spin on the popular Christmas Ad’s often ran by large department stores this time of year and has set a goal to help raise £15k to keep the Winter Shelter open.

There were no actors used in the video, the family in the film are Lydia and Rob Merry, clients of Herringbone Kitchens and the homeless man is James Duff, who was previously homeless and now is a Trustee of Catching Lives. Red Cape Productions made and produced the film and Maxine Scott produced and recorded the single ‘Together We Can.’ The filming was shot across Canterbury and at the Winter Night Shelter at Catching Lives.

Together there are easy ways to help support the homeless, through giving time or money. Help us help this wonderful charity continue their work keeping people in need safe this winter period - donate here.

Some of the feedback from people who accessed the winter shelter last year –

"I have not had to suffer the severe weather conditions. I have also not had to cope with passers-by at night which could be quite frightening when sleeping flat on the ground. It was a relief and very welcome to be offered the opportunity to have a space in the night shelter."

“Thank you to the churches. Thank you for the peace where we can sleep. Thank you for the tea, coffee and all the food."

Please help this wonderful charity to continue their life saving work keeping homeless people safe this winter.
Title: Herringbone Kitchens Christmas Appeal

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I've been dj-ing for 20 years, I've done the bars, clubs and festivals and nowadays do private events, corporate and weddings and since the lockdown began I've been doing FB LIVE streaming DJ sets from my kitchen, which have quickly turned into a weekly show dubbed the Saturday 'Kitchen Rave'.

Following overwhelming support from thousands of listeners around the globe, I've decided to challenge myself and put my energy and love for music into a mammoth 24hr DJ set to raise as much money as possible for our beloved NHS!!

I've always said I would do this one day... the time has come!

PLEASE JOIN ME ON THIS EPIC JOURNEY!

Starting at 6pm on Friday 8th May, I will DJ my way through 16 different genres of music over a 24hr period finishing with my personal favourite - the Saturday Kitchen Rave Trance Anthems show on Saturday 9th May 4-6pm!

There are NHS and frontline workers doing much more challenging 24hr shifts so the very least I can do is play a whole heap of music in their honour, but I need your help!

Please check out the music schedule here and on my Facebook page (search - Dj Graham Meeres) and join me for whatever music you love to listen to. 

Most importantly - this is a one time event and I want to make the biggest impact possible so please dig deep and give as generously as you can! 

Thanks for all your support so far. Please get involved, share and tag away as many people as you can and if you know anyone in the MEDIA/TV/NEWS business please give them a nudge and let's make this event go national!

ENJOY!

Title: Maggie's Kitchen Table Day

Description:
When Des was diagnosed with oesophageal cancer it was a very difficult time for all the family. We were in the middle of a pandemic, living in lockdown and isolating from friends and family. To be told your cancer is non curative and you only have between 6 and 12 months to live was completely devastating.

We were told to visit the Maggie’s centre near the Christie and we were so glad we did. It is truly a place of calm, a safe haven in the midst of all the trauma.

Des found his diagnosis very difficult to accept. Fortunately he was able to have regular sessions with the Centre’s Psychologist Robin Muir. These chats proved to be invaluable.

Also during this time Laurie and I took part in the friends and family support group online. I actually came to look forward to these Tuesday sessions where people could share their experiences and talk about their fears and worries. It was always good to hear when someone had a clear scan!

While Des was having his treatments I could sit and read in the centre, enjoy the garden, talk to one of the support team, cry and have a cup of tea. Nothing was too much trouble. The emotional support provided was a life line and gave me the strength to keep going.

Sadly Des’s battle with cancer only lasted 7 months, but Maggie’s are still there supporting us as a family. We have taken part in the bereavement groups and continue to meet up regularly. It makes a difference talking to people who have been through the same ordeal.

Maggie’s is completely funded by donations. Having a  ‘kitchen table couple of hours’ is the least we can do to support them.
Title: Maggie's Kitchen Table Day

Description:
I'm hosting a Kitchen Table Day to support people with cancer.

Maggie's were a  fantastic support for me when I was in hospital having my treatment. I visited there on my first time in hospital and during my first ever chemo treatment. I then visited whenever I could whilst having treatment. 

They were very supportive and gave me lots of info to take away and they answered the questions that I had.

They are a vital place for cancer patients to visit so they can come away from a hospital environment, have a chat and have a cuppa!

Title: Maggie's Kitchen Table Day

Description:
I'm hosting a Kitchen Table Day to support people with cancer. Having had breast cancer myself I have benefited from a group set up by the Oxford Maggie Centre so we could share our experiences and offer each other support.

Please help future cancer patients to enable them to come through their treatment knowing other people are there for them and learning how to cope with their diagnoses. 

Thank you

Jane

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Jules Kitchen Advent Calendar

Description:
I will publish a cookbook, Notes From Musicians’ Kitchens, containing recipes submitted by musicians from all over the world, on paper and also digitally by subscription, the proceeds of which will raise money for freelance musicians who are struggling in the aftermath of the Covid-19 virus. If you would like to contribute a recipe, you must be a music professional, it must be your own recipe, free from copyright issues, and be accompanied by a description of why this recipe is special, why it’s your favourite, what it means to you. The personal story is as important as the recipe. For those who don’t like to cook (mentioning no names!), there’ll be a section of easy recipes which are useful when we’re touring. There will be vegan/gluten/dairy-free/Keto recipes in there so everyone has something to try. Not all recipes will make the book, but I will create a digital resource where you can subscribe and access all of the submitted recipes. Your donation to this very worthy charity, which is looking after musicians in crisis, is hugely appreciated. Every penny will go to where ur is needed most. Food is love. Thank you all.

www.notesfrommusicianskitchens.com

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Notes From Musicians Kitchens

Description:
As a working mum of two primary school age children, balancing home school, work and my own mental well-being,  I have seen just a glimpse of just some of the challenges faced by the situation we find ourselves in over the past 10 months, particularly for children. I think we can all agree that things can be pretty tough going at the moment.

Now. We love a dance, sing & disco in our house to help us feel good. It can do wonders for the soul and for our mental health and just generally lift our spirits & make us feel pretty darn GOOD!!

So with that in mind - we’re (mainly me!) going to attempt to dance from 8 till 8!! Oh man!

Saturday 27th February, in our kitchen, 8am till 8pm.

Feel free to (virtually) join to say hi, dance along, share your music & moves, show some support and help raise money for Young Minds.

Plus, it’s my birthday the day before so not exactly sure where else I can go at the moment to dance other than my house...... 😉


Zoom details for Sat 27th Feb :
Meeting number 937 4933 8752
Password 505029


Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Title: Maggie's Kitchen Table Day

Description:
I am raising money for Maggie's Centre, who provide support to families who have been affected by cancer. They have been here for me in the past, emotionally and physically, through my Mum and Aunties’ brave battles. 

I am hosting a tea, coffee and cake afternoon in support of Maggie's to raise awareness of the incredible work they do, and to raise much needed funds for those affected by cancer. 

I am blown away by the support so far, especially from the Year 5 class at Christ the King RCPS Walkden, who are leading a Maggie's fundraising event at the school. 

If you or anyone you know are affected by cancer, I encourage you to learn more about the wonderful work Maggie's do: www.maggies.org 

You're making a difference - thank you!
Title: Kitchen Table Day 2022

Description:
The lasting effects of the Covid-19 crisis on the lives of children and young people are extensive, but BBC Children in Need is here to make sure that no child is left behind. Currently funding over 2,500 local charities and projects across the UK, BBC Children in Need supports children and young people to thrive and be the best they can be.

Join in and together, we can change young lives.

Title: Maggie's Kitchen Table Day

Description: Maggie's have helped my family so much over the last 2 years. Coping with cancer at any age is difficult and when you are young or have a young family it seems to have extra hurdles to navigate, like how do you tell a young child their parent is seriously ill. Maggie's support and guidance is an invaluable tool for parents and individuals who are already going through an unimaginably hard time. Any donations made to this charity will be going to a good cause and will be greatly appreciated!
Title: Kitchen Table Day 2022

Description: After 40 successful years providing first class customer service Avanti are looking to give a little bit back to the communities who have supported us for so long. To celebrate our 40th anniversary we are aiming to raise £40,000 for charities that our very much close to all of our hearts. Please keep an eye on our website for a list and updates of the activities we have planned throughout the year.
Title: Avanti Kitchens - Smile for Joel

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

The Kitchen Croxley is so proud to partner with Peace Hospice Care. We were excited and looking forward to their Fundraising Dinner this week, for which we had baked 150 cupcakes.

Sadly today they made this announcement which we agree with totally.  "We are very sad to announce that we have taken the difficult decision to postpone our major fundraising events for the next 3 months – including our Charity Dinner and London Bridges Walk.  This is due to concerns about the Coronavirus (COVID-19)."

Rather than waste the cupcakes we had baked we offered them to our Facebook followers in return for a donation. The response has totally overwhelmed us. Over sixty people have shared our page, including the legendary footballer Luther Blissett. We have had donations from overseas and now a request to set up this page.

The cupcakes have all gone but we are baking more. We are also asking/inviting others to make donations simply because the Fundraising Dinner is so vital to the income of the Peace Hospice.

So here is the thing. Please donate the cost of a cup of coffee. Or a glass of wine, pint of beer or cocktail. Afternoon Tea if you feel able, or simply a cupcake. Pop in and pick one up if you are local.

Our original target was £100 but let's make that £1000. The work these people do is just so wonderful and the effort they put into this event just awesome. Please bring a smile to their faces and to those of their patients too. Thank you!

Mrs Kitchen x

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: The Kitchen Croxley Cupcake Sale

CharityName: World Food Programme - Prism the Gift Fund
Description:
Since I started working on Tahdiglover I always tried to bring something new to the table and to make a difference.


I have decided going forward , I will raise fund for a charity organisation every month.


For the month of July I would like to dedicate the 3rd episode of the Tahdiglover live Kitchen to the malnutrition crisis.


Our first fundraising will be for the World Food Program.


I am collaborating with @pasagard to hold a raffle for this fundraising campaign.


Every £5 donation is one entry to the raffle . Please submit your full name when donating. (Link in bio)


The winner will receive 8g of Pasargard #Persian Saffron.


Tune in to our live show as we will announce the winner on our show on the 5th July. Link to the show >> 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4yTFuV6Q_zY
Title: Tahdiglover Live Kitchen Charity

Title: Maggie's Kitchen Table Day

Description:
I'm hosting a Kitchen Table Day to help Maggie's be there for those dealing with cancer. 

Last year after a routine mammogram I was diagnosed with breast cancer. It had spread to my lymph nodes and I was waiting for the results of my Oncotype test to determine whether or not I needed Chemo, it's the waiting for results which is just the scariest . However whilst we were waiting Ian and I found Maggie's . It is a little oasis in the grounds of the Freeman, Newcastle, and indeed many other UK hospitals . 

Everyone whom has a cancer diagnosis , or indeed a daughter, husband , friend with cancer needs to find Maggie's.  However you are coping, Maggie's just makes it easier. Don't just think it is for others, it is for everyone.

Maggie's story is fascinating - look it up

Thank you for reading this

Jane xxx
Title: Maggie's Kitchen Table Day

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

This event is on Saturday 26th March 2-5pm (not 25th as stated above!)
Title: Beth's Kitchen Table Fundraiser

Description:
Thanks for supporting my fundraising. At Macmillan, we give people with cancer everything we’ve got. If you’re diagnosed, your worries are our worries. We’re doing whatever it takes. But without your help we can’t support everyone who needs us.Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs.


Myself general manager Daniel hyde and kitchen manager Anthony atkin are both skydiving in May for macmillian.

We are both doing a 10000ft skydive in support for macmillian cancer support
Title: General and kitchen manager skydive

Title: Sonnys Kitchen Yemen Appeal

Description:
﻿With less than a week to go until Peter’s end of year townhall, where Peter will announce whether we have achieved our (ambitious!) fundraising target of £325k,our fundraising for Coram currently stands at…. (d﻿rum roll) …. just under £313k. An incredible amount!

However, having raised such a huge amount, it would be great to really finish the year off on a high by breaking through the £325k marker.

I wrote to our SLT committing to donate £150 to Coram if Peter volunteers to work in the 440 kitchen for half a day (the kitchen day is very long:  0430 – 2330!) with Peter Fiori and team.  A number of you have kindly agreed to join me in donating!

We look forward to seeing the pictures, Peter!﻿



Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Peter Flavel's Kitchen Challenge

Description:
‘And they give food in spite of love for it to the needy, the orphan, and the captive, [Saying], “We feed you only for the countenance of Allah. We wish not from you reward or gratitude”’. (Qur’an, 76:8-9)

The Open Kitchen is free and open to all. It provides hot nutritious meals, twice a day, seven days a week.

The Kitchen will provide those experiencing food poverty with a safe space run for and by the community, where they will be treated with respect and dignity.

You can find us at: 514 Great West Road, Hounslow, London, TW5 0TE.

£35 can provide 10 meals
£70 can provide 20 meals
£140 can provide 40 meals
£350 can run the kitchen for one day (100 meals)

£30 per month can keep the kitchen open for the needy

Please donate generously and help those less fortunate.
Title: The Open Kitchen - Jumuah Collection

Description: After 40 successful years providing first class customer service Avanti are looking to give a little bit back to the communities who have supported us for so long. To celebrate our 40th anniversary we are aiming to raise £40,000 for charities that our very much close to all of our hearts. Please keep an eye on our website for a list and updates of the activities we have planned throughout the year.
Title: Avanti Kitchens - Beacon Centre

Description: Update on my challenge! I have now potted up over 80 tree seedlings that have been popping up in my garden and would otherwise have been thrown away.  Can you sponsor me to finish this task ??  They seem to be growing pretty well - though a squirrel did dig into the pots where the horse chestnuts were growing to get at the conkers !  I have already found homes for 15 trees - thank you everyone.
Title: Log Cabin and Kitchen Extension

Description:
Make your donations here for your extra raffle tickets for the PTA Big Kitchen Disco! All donations from this page will be made to your chosen charity Go Beyond! Good luck for the evening and many thanks for your generous donations and supporting a fantastic charity! The Waterfront Support Team xx

Description: I'm hosting a Kitchen Table Day to support people with cancer.  Having experienced the amazing services Maggies Edinburgh provided me 5 years ago when I went through a storm of emotions after a cancer diagnosis, it’s great to have the opportunity to say thank you.  I’ve recently visited Forth Valley Maggies and like all these Centres funding is essential for their work to continue.  So I’m doing this out of gratitude for the workers and volunteers who keep these Centres going.
Title: Maggie's Kitchen Table Day

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

We making cotton face masks for free to anyone who requires them.

If you want to make a donation please do so through this page all donations will be going to
NHS Charities Together


Thank you and stay safe
Title: West Kitchens Face Masks

Description:
Hi everyone! 

Just a little page I’ve set up here as I know, like many people, I’ve felt a little bit helpless and wanting to support more during this strange time we're all living in. There’s not one of us who won’t be effected in some way by what’s going on and I know we are hearing a lot about the devastation, but there are many positives popping up too with people coming together (virtually), raising money, and the general recognition for the incredible key workers and those on the frontline (NHS, Armed Forces, Carers, Food suppliers and Supermarket workers, Hospital cleaners, Police, Teachers, etc). 


The brilliant 5k challenge got me wondering if there’s something similar but from home, especially for anyone unable to run or get outside right now. I so far haven’t found a page where you cook/bake, post, nominate, and DONATE some money for EACH INGREDIENT used in your masterpiece…so this is what I’m starting here! I’ve seen so many fab chefs and bakers come out of the woodworks during this period - so why not help and donate a little something whilst you’re at it (it may be something you're making for yourself or others, and can also be a therapeutic way to manage any anxieties this may all be bringing).

 

I’ve baked/made a load of things mainly with ingredients we already had since the lockdown began and have now donated £1 for every ingredient used. Just ONE bake or dish (it doesn’t have to be cake or anything overly fancy - unless you want it to be! Anything sweet or savoury, baked or cooked) could make a difference (even those ‘3 ingredient recipes’ will still be something) and they can be healthy too (although this isn’t a requirement...😉). We all know some essentials are a little scarce right now so consider it a challenge to get creative too! 


This can include something you’ve made during this period already, just:

- Share a picture of it on your Instagram or Facebook (if you don’t have access to these, send to someone who can share it for you)

- Add #pitchinfromthekitchen 

- Nominate however many people you’d like for them to give it a go too (although you DON’T need to wait to be nominated as you can start your own chain!)

- And DONATE £1 for EACH ingredient used in that recipe. 

There are tonnes of completely worthy charities this could go to. A key one is of course ‘NHS Charities Together’ who I donated half to; the other half I donated to Trussell Trust (supporting food banks). As you can only select one charity through Just Giving, ALL donations through this page’s link will go directly to ‘NHS Charities Together.’ In addition to the sheer importance of the NHS to me (and all of us), I’ve chosen this one having read about the invaluable support these funds could offer to the incredible NHS volunteers, frontline staff, isolated patients and their families right now, which I’m hoping will last a long time even after this has passed. I've also heard first hand accounts from those I know who are working at all costs on the frontline; so this is my very small way of saying a very big thank you. 


Here’s to a target of £200 to start with and kicking it off by nominating people who I know love to bake or cook! Enjoy, and stay safe! x 


NB: Any donations have been processed once you receive the ‘donation complete or thank you ✅’ message, but this can take a few hours to show up on the fundraising page.

Instagram: pitch_in_from_the_kitchen 

Facebook: Pitch in from the kitchen 


- - - - - - 

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Pitch in from the Kitchen, for the NHS

Description:
WELCOME TO MY KITCHEN CHALLENGE! Hey everyone! In order to raise money for the NHS and show gratitude and respect to the heroes working tirelessly on the front line, I have decided to start a fun challenge! Here’s the plan: you create a dish in your kitchen; this can be anything you like! Maybe it’s your favourite meal, a dessert you love, your go-to breakfast dish, the ultimate comfort food, what you were planning to make for dinner tonight, the quickest recipe you know, a dish that holds a special place in your heart...anything at all! Create your dish, donate £5 using the just-giving link, post a picture on social media with the hashtags #welcometomykitchen and #£5 and tag 5 friends who you nominate to take part next! It’s that simple! Please feel free to jazz up your social media posts; is there a fun story that goes with your dish? A special memory? Or maybe you can include the recipe if you like! Please get involved and share with lots of friends! Thank you! 

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: WELCOME TO MY KITCHEN CHALLENGE

Description:
I'm hosting a Kitchen Table Day to support people with cancer.

“Maggie’s is a charity providing free cancer support and information in centres across the UK and online.”

I am having a coffee and cake morning on the 2nd April at 11am at home. Join us for a bit of fun and a chat over coffee. Donate to this amazing cause helping those with cancer and their family at a vulnerable time with information, well-being and a listening ear.

Thank you

Title: Vintage Kitchen Easter raffle

Description: Lumos is fighting for every child’s right to have a family. There are over 5.4 million children trapped in institutions globally. These intuitions severely harm a child's physical and mental development. We are fighting for every child's right to grow up at home, in a safe and loving family.
Title: Scherene's Slava Ukraini Fundraising Event

Description:
Umm Ma’bad (R.A) dedicated her life towards Khidmah (service) of people. She set up a tent in the middle of the desert to assist and provide food to travellers. Her Khidmah was accepted by Allah Subhaanahu Wata'aala and she was honoured with the presence of Our Beloved Prophet Sayyidinaa Muhammad ﷺ. This blessing that led her to narrate the captivating sight she witnessed through her noble description of the Greatest of Creation ﷺ that would travel beyond generations.


Through her inspiration we endeavour to serve the creation with the ultimate aim of presenting Our Master Muhammad ﷺ to the world at large... InshaAllah!


Umm Ma’bads Kitchen is aiming to raise £10,000 towards the new Madrasah project for Bayt Muhammad Academy


Donate Today! Earn your share of endless reward!

Instagram: @umm_mabads_kitchen
Title: Umm Mabads Kitchen Appeal for Bayt Muhammad Academy

Description:
The British Red Cross plays a vital role in emergency response, and the ongoing, ever-changing situation concerning the COVID-19 pandemic is no exception.

In times of crisis, we’re here to help people. We’re local and we’re global and we’ve been doing this for 150 years. Our network of incredible staff and volunteers means we are uniquely placed to reach people in fearful, uncertain times. 

But it’s the generosity of our supporters that enables our work to happen quickly and efficiently. We rely on your support to keep us going.
Title: Warburtons Commercial Kitchen Bake Sale

Description:
Hi Guys,



SHOC are having to move from their home of 20 years as Slough Council have requested their building back. They have found a new place to call home but it has inadequate facilities to feed 50+ people a day and has no showers so people can wash themselves - something I certainly take for granted.

I will be attempting to do everything I can to fit a new kitchen, 2 showers, 2 toilets and as much other work as humanly possible to aid people who desperately need it. Luckily a few companies have offered help so far also, but we still need more:

BenchMarx, High Wycombe will be giving the kitchen for free (benchmarxkitchens.co.uk)

Grant and Stone will provide all building, plumbing and bathroom materials at cost (grantandstone.co.uk)

Jack of Glass, High Wycombe have offered cost price items - windows and splashbacks (jackofglass.co.uk)

My company Howard Smith Premium Builders will be providing all electrical work free as well as a portion of the building (howardsmithbuilders.co.uk)

We urgently need donations (or skilled labour) to assist us and give SHOC the ability to carry on helping people who's lives do depend on it, especially come winter...

Kind regards

Howard Smith
Title: SHOC urgently need a kitchen, shower and toilet for their new property

Description:
Thank you to Nicole at tannoch tots nursery for letting me organise a Maggie's kitchen table day bake sale! I am raising funds for Maggie's lanarkshire which is a drop in cancer based in the grounds of monklands hospital. We provide emotional and practical support for anyone affected by cancer.

If you can't make it please donate 😊


Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Ruth's Maggie's kitchen table day

Description:
I supported maggies through a company I used to work with , they were the nominated charity for a year . During this time I helped out in their Glasgow centre . I was really touched by the work they do , the support they provide and the lovely people people that work there . As the company I worked for moved onto another charity , I still felt compelled to do what I could for maggies . 

My 2 sister in laws died  of cancer and I wished I could have taken them to maggies but sadly they didn’t get the chance . 

I always wanted to volunteer at the centres but work full time and I help out with child care for my grand kids 

Neither of my sister in laws got to be grans  

I’m doing this for them and will continue to do what I can for maggies as long as I’m able ♥️
Title: Margaret's Maggies donation instead of xmas cards sent

CharityName: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation
Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

It started out as a bit of fun to brighten up a Saturday evening, and bring some fun and laughter to people on our Facebook. Some who we knew were on their own or friends we knew we would connect and have a laugh with. It went really well.

So we thought, why not raise money as well for our local hospital. We didn’t expect the response we have had and we are just blown away by the kindness of people.

We are a family, A FAT BOY CHURCH FAMILY!!
Title: Lorraine's FATBOY Church In His Kitchen

Description: Noah Donohoe (14) went missing from his home in South Belfast on Sunday 21st June 2020. He was a boy with many academic, sporting and artistic talents alongside a huge generosity of spirit. His Mum Fiona has set up the Noah Donohoe Foundation in his memory; a foundation that will support the causes and issues that Noah cared about.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

On Friday 17th November, some senior staff at Gateways will be taking over the kitchen to prepare lunch service for the whole school!  

Dr Johnson, Mrs Wallis, Mrs Titman, Mrs Wood and Mrs Bartle will be putting on their Chef's Whites (and some entertaining headwear) all in aid of BBC Children in Need and the school charity, Martin House Hospice for Children and Young People.

However, they are not putting themselves at the whim of Wayne (aka Gordon Ramsay) for nothing - money must be raised by you the Gateways community to support these two worthy causes.

So please click to donate as generously as you can if BBC Children in Need is your preferred charity.  Even as little as £5 donated by parents for each child they have in the school would mean that around £2000 could be raised.  But we are sure you can do much better than this ...!
Title: Gateways School does Hell's Kitchen for BBC Children in Need

Description:
I'm selling plants to support the care for people with cancer.

I was diagnosed last year with cancer and even through lock down, I had so much support from Maggie's in Southampton.

I'm also doing it in memory of all people who lost the battle and especially for my father who was a keen gardener.
Title: Maggie's Garden Table Day

Description:
Last year with your help, we raised a total of £292.50 for the people's kitchen.

My 2021 festive fundraiser for the People's kitchen is still active if anybody wishes to donate; The People's Kitchen is a charity that provides friendship, food and clothing for homeless people located within Newcastle.

When I look at homeless people on the street, I see people with purpose and potential that society has given up on; with the right help, these people can lead extremely fulfilling lives.

Please donate to this cause if you would like to do so, there's absolutely no obligation, and even a little goes a long way.

Description:
I'm hosting a Kitchen Table Day where we will visit our new lambs! 

I am asking for a dontaion on behalf of the Maggies centre to support other cancer patients and their families.

The volunteers, staff and other users of Maggies have provided me with much needed support after my breast cancer diagnosis and treatment. I want to be able to give something back.

Thank you for any help you can provide xx
Title: Fundraising for Maggie's - Lambs!!

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page! 

My Special Fridge and Kitchen cupboards cleaning costs £30 and last  two hours: it is a short time but I do my best not only to make fridges, freezers and kitchen, including cupboards, spic and span but also to make people conscious that their health and wellbeing starts with their nutrition choices. 

I suggest everybody to think what could happen if they had no access to healthy food. 

Foodbanks can literally save lives, providing controlled (safe) and healthy food to people who do not have any money, credit, friends or relatives or mental capacity to take care of themselves particularly after an eviction, an injury, an emotional breakdown or any other crisis circumstance.

For any Fridge and Kitchen Special Cleaning service  I suggest to donate 1 to 5£ to help Southwark foodbank in Peckham (Pecan).

Disclaimer: Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Maria's Special Cleaning - Fridge and Kitchen

Description:
I'm not going to leave the kitchen from midday on Saturday till midday on Sunday, unless I need the toilet.

I'm doing this to help the charity. It's quite hard but I have to do it because I'm being sponsored. 

Thank you. 
Harper
Title: Harper's 24-hour kitchen challenge

Description:
Hello and thanks for taking the time to read about my very personal, somewhat mad challenge.


I turn 50 at the beginning of Feb (I mean....how did that happen?) and was determined not to let this be "The Big One" the Covid Grinch stole.  So, I decided to remember this milestone instead as the time I did something really worthwhile by raising money for dementia research.  Why?  Because this is a dreadful disease which steals those we love and we all deserve to grow old with dignity.  I'm an NHS doctor....please believe me.


I love a kitchen disco.  I always have.  One of my earliest memories is waltzing around the kitchen perched on my godfather's feet while mum tried to cook the Sunday roast around us.  That set the pattern for midnight boogieing in Uni digs (oh, INXS), Christmas tree decorating parties for two (Black Eyed Peas will always mean baubles to me!) and grand displays of Riverdance post dinner like any self respecting Irish girl.  Welllll, I had fun even if I wasn't going to score very highly from the Strictly judges.


So, I thought what better way to mark my birthday than in this tried and tested fashion.  From the morning of Saturday Jan 30th I'll be taking to the dance floor for 24 hours, with only a 5 minute break every hour to run to the loo/ change my socks/ sob a little.  Thanks to Covid it's a disco for one, though my amazing partner will be on hand with snacks and encouragement.  (He might even have a wee shimmy!)  Some of my friends have offered to remotely DJ for a couple of hours but, otherwise, it'll be a mix of playlists from my 5 decades interspersed with my trusted Radio 2.


It'll be a long night.  I've worked hard to get fitter and have discovered that I do have a core!  But I'll not lie, it's quite an undertaking and I am nervous.  


I need your help.  Please, please consider sponsoring my effort- not for me but for this important research.  Even if you can't pledge any money, do please send some encouragement to get me through.  Oh and any suggestions for tunes to save me from The Nolans and Kids From Fame on a loop!  You can follow me on twitter on @AreeSinead.  And- thank you!

Oh T and Cs from Just Giving-           

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Sinead's 24 hour Kitchen Disco!

Description:
I'm hosting a Kitchen Table Day to support people with cancer on 25th March 2022 at my home. My frount door will be open between 8.45am till 3.30pm serving cake and snacks for any donations. 

I just wanted to give a little back anyway we can. Maggie's have been invaluable to myself and my family over the years. I want others to receive the same benefits and support like we did when we needed it the most.

I will be donating some dry foods from my business for you to buy and all the money go's to Maggie's. 

Join me for our Maggies Kitchen Table Day on Friday 25th March 2022. To help raise funds and help me hit a £50 target to bring much needed funds and awareness for the Maggie's centre's. 

See you Friday! 

68 Fisher Street 

OL13RJ 

Between 8.45am - 3.30pm

Description:
On March 21st, we're hosting a special version of our weekly community meal, Sunny's Kitchen, to fundraise in support of the DEC Ukraine Humanitarian Appeal. We really appreciate any donations towards this appeal. 

Heavy fighting, shelling and air strikes across Ukraine have had devastating consequences. Already, over 2.5 million people have fled their homes to escape intense conflict in Ukraine. Leaving behind loved ones, livelihoods and almost everything they own, they need shelter, food, and water. People are losing their homes and lives, essential services like water and healthcare have been hit and temperatures have dropped below zero. 

Please support our fundraiser to help reach those in urgent need in Ukraine and neighbouring countries. With your help we can support ActionAid and the DEC (Disasters Emergency Committee) in scaling up their response and help families to stay warm and protect women and girls. 

This response includes: 

  • Supporting families with food, first aid and medicines
  • Supporting hospitals and healthcare facilities
  • Repairing vital infrastructure
  • Helping to repair homes, healthcare centres, schools and community centres.
Title: Ukraine Humanitarian Crisis

Description:
Hello,



Thank you for visiting our fundraising page. The Luton Curry Kitchen is a pioneering partnership project between Community Interest Luton (CIL), and Discover Islam Information Centre to support the needy and vulnerable in Luton.



The food is prepared by Venue Central and distributed by volunteers from the Discover Islam Centre, every Friday. As well as having people visiting the Centre for food, we visit shelters around the town to deliver hot meals to those in temporary shelter.



We encourage locals to get involved with this great cause by donating towards the cause. The Curry Kitchen costs £150 per week to fund and serves more than 100 people each week.



For more information, please email contact@discover-islam.co.uk
Title: Luton Curry Kitchen supporting the needy and homeless of Luton

Title: Unity The After Cure Choir's Rescheduled Fundraiser Sat July 2nd 2022

Description:
Hi All,

My brother and I (Patrick and Phoebe Mayhew) were planning on staying in Calais between the 8th and 15th of September and volunteering in The Refugee Community Kitchen for 6 days. However, we both ended up going separately as Patrick had to delay his trip and isolate after testing positive for Covid, instead he left for Calais on the 19th September and is staying there for a week. The refugee kitchen need essential donations, as well as volunteers, in order to keep them running. We are trying to raise some money from friends and family to support their amazing work feeding the refugee camps in Calais - see below for more information from the charity.

'After maintaining a number of their UK Outreach services throughout the pandemic, they are ready to rebuild in Northern France and to resume full service throughout the UK. A small COVID-19 response team, including the co-founders, are re-opening the kitchen, assessing the need in the region and slowly, safely and ethically rebuilding our operations accordingly. They we need your support as we rebuild!Please donate and share, so that they can rebuild our stores of essentials such as rice, spices, gloves, Vegware, beans, oil, fresh veg, fuel and much more!£10 = 12 litres of cooking oil£20 = 75 tins of tomatoes£50 = 55kg Basmati rice£100 = 85kg dried beansRCK is 100% dependent on donations, they really need your support in this crucial time. Please help us get back on their feet so that we can continue our mission of serving nutritious food without judgement.'

Thank you so much all - send us both a message if you want to chat to us to find out more.

All the best,

Phoebe and Patrick
Title: Help Refugee Community Kitchen rebuild after COVID-19!

In this time of lockdown, none of us can visit our local cafe or restaurant, but this way, we can enjoy a cuppa and a cake and give much needed support to the people on the frontline who are saving lives.

And remember.....

Love is something if you give it away,
Give it away, give it away.
Love is something if you give it away,
You end up having more.
It's just like a magic penny,
Hold it tight and you won't have any.
Lend it, spend it, and you'll have so many
They'll roll all over the floor.
For love is something if you give it away,
Give it away, give it away.
Love is something if you give it away,
You end up having more.

words and music by Malvina Reynolds; copyright 1955 and 1958 Northern Music Corporation, renewed 1986. a.k.a. "Love Is Something."

Description: Red Nose Day is back on Friday 18 March, and we can’t wait to get involved in the fun. This year, we’re raising money as part of the Big Red Nose Day Get Together. We’re joining people up and down the UK to turn smiles into something incredible for those who need it most. However much you can spare, your donation will help tackle poverty, take action against violence and bring an end to discrimination – in the UK and across the world. We’re fundraising for Red Nose Day because... • £5 could pay to get 20 meals to vulnerable children and families in the UK • £10 could provide 20 reading books for children in community learning centres in Northern Uganda, where free pre-school services are very limited • £20 could provide a supportive coffee morning for families in the UK to share advice on caring for their child’s mental health Don’t forget to tick the Gift Aid option, if you can, so Comic Relief can claim an extra 25% from the government. From us and everyone at Comic Relief, thank you. You’re wonderful.
Title: Laura A is fundraising for Red Nose Day 2022

Description:
'A revolutionary way of helping that provides humanity and nourishment to hungry and vulnerable people creating a connected and kinder world & our mission is to give highly nutritional food support to displaced people whatever their situation. Food is a language the crosses all borders.'

Dear friends! Tomorrow I will be embarking on a 321km solo hike along the Camino Primitivo, the oldest and most challenging of the Camino de Santiago pilgrimage routes.

I felt compelled to do this walk out of a sense of - to put it poetically - 'AAAAAGH' about the tumultuousness of young adult life and a need to do something as simple as putting one foot in front of the other for two and a half weeks by myself.


But how seriously lucky I am to be making a tremendous journey just for the sake of journeying! How fortunate I am to be fed and housed and cheered every step of the way! Hundreds of thousands make journeys a billion times more challenging than mine, and they'll do it hungry and unhoused and in the face of great hostility.


So I'll be raising funds for Refugee Community Kitchen as I plod along the Spanish mountains. RCK run an entirely volunteer-based set of kitchens in London and Northern France dedicated to serving nutritious and comforting meals to 1500 displaced and unhoused people every day - and they rely entirely on donations to keep up their incredible work.


I have set an initial fundraising target of £500 which would cover the cost of onions for 22,500 meals. I'm making a £200 donation to kickstart this, which is based on how much it would have costed me to travel by train to Calais to volunteer with RCK. If you have just a couple of quids spare to support a nutritious meal for somebody in Calais or on the streets of London, your support for this cause will go much appreciated and will cheer me along my journey :~)


Cait x
Title: Caitlin's Camino for Refugee Community Kitchen

Description:
According to the UNHCR (The UN High Commissioner for Refugees) There are an estimated 84 million displaced people in the world with over 35 million being Children. This statistic is so shocking, big and sad. 

Jess Webb, Shaun Warmington and I (Beth) decided to try and support a fantastic cause that provides food to refugees in France and England. Refugee Community Kitchen (RCK) have been serving nutritious food without judgement to those fleeing war, poverty, persecution and climate change since 2015. The work that RCK does is a revolutionary way of helping that provides humanity and nourishment to hungry and vulnerable people creating a connected and kinder world. Their mission is to give highly nutritional food support to displaced people no matter their situation. 

We will FINALLY  be heading over there in June for 6 days (delayed due to Covid) to volunteer with RCK and try and give back a little bit to those who need it the most. If you are in a place to donate financially to this cause, please give what you can. 

Food is a language that crosses all borders <3

Description: The Kindness Kitchens have been working from Clarence Rd carpark for several years and were known as the soup kitchens (Homeless Eats, Street Spirit, Mikey's Memory Kitchen and the Homeless Hub). They have been dedicated community groups who are determined to support vulnerable people in our community.  Most nights of the week, they provide hot meals to those in need. These are amazing acts of kindness.  St Vincent's Southend Community Support Hub  have partnered with the Kindness Kitchens who are now united in providing this essential service from a safe and under cover building.  These funds that are being raised will be put towards their operations such as rent, food supplies and other resources needed to support the vulnerable people that they feed.  Please visit our website at www.svpwestcliff.org if you want to join our volunteers in supporting those in need or donate to this fund to support all the great work that the Kindness kitchens do.
Title: Kindness Kitchens - feeding those in need.

Description:
In February 2021 I was diagnosed with Stage 3 Ovarian cancer. Everything has not always gone to plan, my op was longer, my chemotherapy involved stays in hospital and my current treatment needed tweaks. The knowledge within the Marsden made it all, almost seamless, and I am but one patient. People from all over the world benefit from their expertise.

After raising £2250 for Macmillan, this is now my way of thanking the Marsden for their care of me and all the other patients, both now and in the future. My current oral chemotherapy will last for another two years and thereafter I will have checks - I have no urgent end date of my fundraising so as I am often asked to do demonstrations, lessons and talks, sometimes instead of a fee, I will direct them to here. I will also run specific fundraisers. It makes me feel really good doing this and any amount of donation is great, I just feel incredibly fortunate to be able to use my skills to raise money.

So where will the money go?

 Well, The Royal Marsden are known world-wide as a world-leading cancer centre and The Royal Marsden Cancer Charity raises money solely to support The Royal Marsden.  They ensure nurses, doctors and research teams provide the very best care and develop life-saving treatments, used across the UK and around the world. Pioneering research is absolutely critical to extending, improving and saving the lives of more people diagnosed with cancer. From funding state-of-the-art equipment and ground-breaking research, to creating the very best patient environments, they will never stop looking for ways to improve the lives of people affected by cancer. 

Thank you for your support,

Love Ruth










.

Title: Janet Kitchen & Robert Searles's Wedding

Description:

I have been extremely lucky with all the care given to me and the resources I have made a great deal of use of are from Macmillan. 

I wanted to do something to raise money for charity and decided that since I wanted to use a Macmillan resource, Recipes for People Affected by Cancer and hold some cook togethers - this would be a good starting point. 

The recipes are simple, healthy and during the sessions I will discuss how they can be adapted. All info will come from the above resource. You don't have to have cancer to join in, all sessions will be a friendly place to be, you don't even need to cook! I have initially set up three sessions but if they are popular, I will carry on - I used to have people to my house to cook but for the time being this will be equally lovely to do.

Any donation would be welcome as a one -off or per session -  or just to donate to an amazing cause and help others - up to you.

If you want to book onto one of the Zoom Cook togethers then here is the link which will give you all the info. If you cant make it live they will be recorded and you will be sent a link.

https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/ruths-little-kitchen-cook-together-tickets-150883439429

So thanks for supporting my fundraising. Below a little more about Macmillan.

At Macmillan, we give people with cancer everything we’ve got. If you’re diagnosed, your worries are our worries. We’re doing whatever it takes. But without your help we can’t support everyone who needs us.

Title: Team Bald - NHS (Quarry Kitchen)

Description:
Hello friends of Derby, 

On 26th January 2017, a day after my 21st birthday, our family has rescued a dog which was abused and abandoned on the streets of South Korea. We've named her "Gaon (가온)", an acronym from the following phrase - "가만히 있었는데 선물처럼 다가온 강아지" - which means "a dog which has entered into our family's lives like a surprise gift" in Korean. 

She has been a real gift to our family - animal welfare has taken a huge place in our hearts ever since.

About the project:

From now until 25th January 2022, I will start a cook-sale/bake-sale project to help raise funds for the RSPCA, a non-profit organisation dedicated to rescuing animals when they need us most, rehabilitate them wherever possible, provide them with the very best veterinary care, and to find them new homes, either through rehoming or release. 

I'd like to ask for your generous contributions to this charity in exchange for the Korean foods I'll cook and prepare just for you, upon order (details below). I can't believe there is no Korean restaurants in Derby - the rich Korean flavours must be tried!

How ordering works:

  • Please access the following link to my Instagram page  dedicated to this project:
  • Ordering from menu: Using the "Menu" highlight, please see the menus you'll be able to order from. You'll also be able to check the ingredients and ensure they suit your dietary requirements using the "Ingredients" highlight. Once you've chosen your menu, please make an order through the Google form linked in the Instagram profile. 
  • Custom ordering: If there's a specific Korean menu you've always wanted to try but isn't available in the menus, please let me know and I might be able to whip something up! :)
  • You're most welcome to donate any amounts - but this will need to be at least GBP 5 per serving and per dish to cover costs. All collections will be donated to RSPCA via this donation page. 

How delivery works:

  • Please be advised that the foods will be delivered only on weekends. The foods will be prepared at high standards of hygiene and cleanliness on the day of the delivery, for freshness. Food safety is my number one priority!
  • Depending on the delivery location, I may be able to arrange a meet up with you to deliver the foods, or you may need to come pick them up from my place. If required, you'll be sent details of my location.

About RSPCA:

  • RSPCA continue saving animals most in need throughout England and Wales.The RSPCA received over 1 million calls from members of the public in 2018 and rescued over 102,900 animals. If you would like to find out more about the work the RSPCA does please take a look at their website: www.rspca.org.uk/whatwedo
